response.overview: Civil rights legend Fannie Lou Hamer is remembered by those who worked side by side with her in the struggle for voting rights. An African-American sharecropper from the Mississippi Delta, Hamerâ€™s difficulty registering to vote in 1962 led to her career as an outspoken activist, congressional candidate, and fierce fighter for the rights of all.
response.tagline: Civil rights legend Fannie Lou Hamer is remembered by those who worked side by side with her in the struggle for voting rights.
response.title: Fannie Lou Hamer: Stand Up
